intro: Pultenaea cunninghamii, commonly known as the golden pultenaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
